headline: Awesome and Easy Creamy Corn Casserole
description: This corn casserole is easy to prepare with butter, eggs, cornbread mix, whole and creamed corn, and sour cream for a family-pleasing side dish.

video.description: This creamy casserole is like a cross between corn soufflé and corn pudding.
video.name: Awesome and Easy Creamy Corn Casserole

name: Awesome and Easy Creamy Corn Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x9-inch baking dish.
Mix whole and creamed corn, cornbread mix, sour cream, melted butter, and eggs together in a medium bowl until well combined. Spoon mixture into the prepared dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: The base of this recipe is very good. However, I added a small can of diced green chilies and 1/3 cup of Sargentos 4 cheddar shredded cheese. It is a huge hit at all gatherings with an added kick.
Very easy but a total waste of butter, flavorless
Hard to keep any leftovers.
We are huge regular corn bread lovers, but I wanted to try something a little different. We love the actual corn in this casserole. This recipe is exceptional! So easy and delicious!

Made a double batch twice. First time was excellent. For the second round, I added 1Tbsp each of dried basil and oregano, 2 tsp cayenne powder and substituted the 4 eggs with duck eggs. Will continue to enjoy this recipe.
I didn't change anything or add anything. It is so delicious. I like all the ingredients, cornbread & corn.

ABSOLUTELY DELISH!!! I've prepared this Casserole many times now, and every time it gets better! (Go figure)! This a KEEPER for this family! Thank you all for sharing the recipe! I look forward to more DELISHSIONESS!!! W.L.P.P. (North Carolina)
Just as described, it was delicious. I used Mexican corn and half the amount of butter and cooked it for a full hour.
I got this recipe years ago from the Jiffy Box. On their web site it is called Spoon Bread Casserole. Same as this one. I like to serve with my crab cakes.
It is so easy & delicious!

I have made this for years, it is fantastic. However this is the exact recipe by the original people, Jiffy Mix. You will find the recipe on their website. It just doesn’t tell you to your just any corn bread mix.

Have been making for years. I add bacon and shredded sharp cheddar cheese .... it is so delicious. It usually takes about 55 minutes to cook. If you want a little extra color you can add diced red pepper. YUMMY.
I’ve been using this recipe for over 10 years and it never fails. I substitute cream cheese for the sour cream since I didn’t like the “buttermilk “taste but both are fine.

This casserole is always a huge hit at our holiday get togethers. We add about 4 teaspoons of chopped jalapeño and it gives it the zip that we like. We fixed it without jalapeños one year due to a member of the family that won't eat it with the peppers and it was not as good. So now we make 2, one with peppers and one without.

I really like this dish when nothing sounds good and you’re not feeling so good. It’s soft and can be savory or sweet depending on what you pair with it. I like to drizzle siracha over it when it’s baking for a nice kick to the sweetness of it. It’s also a great casserole for any occasion because it’s so incredibly easy to make.

I love love love this recipe I make it for every pot luck event and everyone loves it, it’s always gone in a few minutes. I add a jalapeño chopped up very small. It doesn’t bring in much spice, it just adds more depth and flavor to it. One thing I’ve noticed is that I usually cook it for more than the 45 minutes mentioned in the recipe. It usually takes about 1 hr. I definitely recommend this recipe.
Very good. Followed the recipe, with the exception of adding some finely chopped onion- about 1/4 cup. Family enjoyed it.
Delicious. Added chopped green onions per one review
I have made this three times and it has been very popular in all three settings (different groups of friends/family), and a few people asked for the recipe (pic is of a double batch in 9x13 pan).
I took this dish to "Bring a dish Thanksgiving Dinner" and two+ woman told me it was the BEST CORN CASSEROLE they ever had, how did I make it. S. Jones
I make this every year for thanksgiving. My friends love it. My niece makes it for her vegan daughter. Said her Mother in law calls it dessert. Such an easy favorite recipe. You can't screw it up.
This is a GREAT recipe but I have always added a cup of shredded colby/monterey jack cheese. It is a staple for Thanksgiving dinner!

I've been making this for a long time. Everyone asks for it on holiday gets together. I've tweaked it over the years. I make double this. I make mine with one jiffy muffin mix and one Martha White regular cornbread. That keeps it from being too sweet (I also use frozen corn which also cut the sweetness. I add a small can of chopped green chilies.
I have made this recipe exactly as written for the past three years for Thanksgiving, and it's always a hit.

Great recipe and the variations are endless. I don’t usually have sweetened cornbread mix on hand so I like to add a little sugar. I double the amount of whole kernel corn, and add a little onion and red bell pepper chopped pretty fine. Maybe some green chilies. I cook it in a well-greased cast iron skillet. Good topped with a handful of grated cheese.
Awesome! I add a diced poblano pepper for color and a little kick.

Made it as a side when my husband was out smoking ribs and other things on his smoker - but wanted to try it out before making for Thanksgiving. We both liked it (I did halve the butter - I will probably go between the 1/4C and 1/2C in next round). Simple to throw together - not sure how much oven space I will have on Thanksgiving so may try crockpot as at least one review indicated
This is great, but beware if you use something other than Jiffy..Jiffy is 8 oz, while Trader Joes and others are 14 oz. so double everything with one box of other mixes.

I have made almost the exact same recipe for 30 years. One difference: I add two beaten eggs and 2 TBSP of sugar, then bake it in a 13 x 9 inch pan. I think my family would rebel if I didn't have this for Thanksgiving.

I have been making this for at least 8 years and my family absolutely loves it! *Note* our families preference: draining the whole kernel corn helps it to come out more cornbread like than wet casserole. *Adding shredded cheese on top at the last 10 minutes of baking is pretty good too.

I just made this as a test run ahead of Thanksgiving.. it's easy and delicious.. I used the sour cream and topped with green onion.. next time I am adding garlic and onion powder for an added flavor depth
I added a 1/4 cup white sugar. Slightly sweet made all the difference in the flavor profile. Great recipe, thank you.
I could eat it everyday ❤️
My family loves this recipe! We make it often and it goes quickly!
I have been making this for years for every holiday. This is one dish my family absolutely loves. Always have to make a double batch. It is so easy and delicious.

My friend gave me this recipe 10 years ago and I make it every year. It is delicious and very easy. I make it ahead of time and cover and leave on the counter as everything is already cooked. You can reheat or serve at room temp. Both ways are delicious!

I've been making this corn pudding for 30 years, but instead of baking it in the oven, I mix the ingredients in my crock pot and cook it for 5-6 hours on Low setting. Easy, and can be served from the crock pot. It's a favorite Thanksgiving dish in my family.
Made it as is, YUMMY! Thank you so much for posting it.
Very good. I added a half teaspoon each garlic powder and onion powder.
no changes for this delicious casserole. it was gone on the first meal!
Super side. But when I tasted this casserole, I could’ve just ate this sweet rich corn casserole and forgot all the rest of the meal. Try this for sure
Amazing I add salt and lots of pepper so amazing and delicious. Reminds me of My mother. Thank you.
This is a piece of heaven in a casserole dish! Super easy & quick to throw together, and absolutely DELICIOUS!!!
Excellent. Was not sure what to expect. A guest stated they thought it would be dry, but it actually was very moist! A keeper, for sure. NAD
This is good stuff. I add a can of green chili
Easy classic sweet corn cassarole...don't mess with it...just make it!!

I have been making this recipe for years! Exactly by this recipe! My son loves it! We eat it with cabbage greens or turnip and mustard greens, green beans and new potatoes...it can really be eaten with just about anything or as a treat with butter and maple syrup or honey!

I make this every time I need to bring a dish. I add 2 tablespoons of sugar to the recipe. As soon as I take it out of the oven, I generously sprinkle powered sugar on the top. Really kicks up the flavor!! Rarely is there any left, but if there is, it heats up well in the microwave the next day.
Super easy prep and always a crowd pleaser!
Super easy and gone first at Thanksgiving! Everyone in the house made me make it again the next day because there were no leftovers!
I added some brown sugar and it was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING and a hit! Next time I’ll add half the amount of butter because it was too greasy. But other than that, we loved it. Thank you!

I live in New Mexico, which means I added Hatch green chili to the batch. If you have access to Hatch green chili (check the frozen foods freezer at your local grocery store) this will really add another layer of taste to this already excellent casserole. My family loved it and I’ll be adding this frequently to my dinner menu. Thanks very much!!!
My grandkids asked for this! I had never made it before. It has been a great hit! I've made it many times and will make for Father's day.
I too have made this recipe for years, but always with an 8 oz container of vanilla yogurt instead of sour cream. Yum
I made it almost per the recipe. Used gluten free cornbread mix. Followed someone’s advice to use half the water in the canned corn. It was the hit of Easter dinner! So easy - thank you!
I used Famous Caves cornbread mix and this turned out great. Took approx 50 mins to bake
I've made this a few times now and it's always a hit. I've even been told by a few people that it's their favorite part of Thanksgiving!
Delicious. I didn’t have any sour cream, so I substituted with Greek yogurt instead. If you like a slightly sweet cornbread, try vanilla Greek yogurt. My family loved it.
The title says it all. Very good corn pudding, easy to make.
This is like cake. It’s not creamy at all. Followed recipe exactly. Dry and like cake. Served it with a pie server. No one likes it at all. I was embarrassed. Needed more sweetness and salt.
Absolutely easy & delicious! This will become a Thanksgiving staple!!
I l?ve this recipe!
I made exactly as instructed and it turned out beautifully. My husband said it was delicious.
Only had 1/2 cup greek yogurt and 1/2 C whipping cream past its date. So that’s what I used along with all other ingredients. Still in oven It was delicious & will make it again

I thought this was OK. I love corn and was really hoping to love this recipe, especially with so many high reviews. But something was off, not sure if it was the texture and lacking in some flavor? But I won't be making this again.
This recipe was a fast and easy recipe that way I could get this done and out of the way and start making the rest of my Christmas dinner!
Too good !!!!!! Lives up to its name.
made no changes and the whole family loved it

Wow, this was really good. It is a new keeper for holiday dinners. I added a little bit of green onion for color. Cooked it in a large round soufflé dish. Love how easy it is. It’s so good, that I could see making this the main entree for a vegetarian dinner. Thanks.
I’m always searching for easy, quick but delicious recipes. I went to a Friendsgiving and brought this. I was nervous since I’d never even tried it. MAJOR hit. They think I’m Bobby Flay! MUST DO!
Always a crowd favorite! I make it every Thanksgiving and Christmas season

Loved it. I did however had no choice but to use the honey corn muffin mix variety b/c the store was out of the regular and added some shredded cheddar cheese into the mix (and topped it with it too) b/c it's what my familia was used to. Family raved over it...it's a keeper!

Easy to make and delicious. Made this last night as a side dish on Thanksgiving. Everybody raved about it. It's a little creamy and moist on the inside, a little crunchy on the bottom. My daughter asked for the recipe after dinner. It's a keeper for sure!
I think I like my corn pudding a bit firmer. Not a fan of souffles I realize.

This was an extremely easy dish to prepare and with three types of corn (whole kernels, creamed and cornmeal mix) really highlights the sweet corn flavor. I made mixed the day before Thanksgiving and refrigerated it. On Thanksgiving Day I took it out 30 minutes before baking to come to room temperature and it turned out great. 
 Everyone liked it, especially the plain eaters (aka, children). If you are looking for a flavor punch, however, you may want to consider adding a pinch of cayenne or green chilies.
No changes but im making it for Thanksgiving so i have to get back with you on how it taste
Delicious!

Love this recipe! Used to make it all the time for office potlucks pre-COVID. Kids love it at home too. Instead of savory, I do sweet, making sure to only include unsalted ingredients for the butter and the corns. I add 2 tbsp of sugar as well to make it extra delightful. Enjoy!

I made this as a test-run for a Thanksgiving side. Followed the recipe exactly and both the boyfriend and I thought it was great! It took closer to an hour, though, for the top to get golden in my oven. No wonder theres's over 3,800 reviews for this dish, and so easy! A lot of possibilities to personalize this dish with additional ingredients, as many reviewers have done.

Very delicious! I couldn't bring myself to put all that butter in, along with the sour cream so halved the butter and the full amount of sour cream. It was wonderful and moist, just like my husband likes it. Thanks for sharing!

I followed the recipe as it and it's wonderful! I made this for Thanksgiving last year and will be making it again this year. My family devoured the whole pan and raved on and on how good it was! Thank you for sharing!
I made this and it is sooo good! I chopped up some onions, about 1/2 cup, and that added so much more flavor. Good either way. Yum ????
I just made this an it was yummy an filling ,I used light sour cream instead though .it's going to be a great dish for Thanksgiving

Great flavor but I prefer the "non cornbread" recipe made with crushed crackers, The texture with this recipe is overpowered with cornbread so its somewhat dryer , Not a bad recipe just not my favorite

Doesn’t get much easier then this recipe! I am gluten and dairy free, so subbed Mayo for sour cream, Gluten Free corn breast mix and Miyoko Vegan Butter..Also melted the stick of butter in on then added the batter. Everyone loved it and I didn’t tell anyone it was gluten free ??

This turned out perfect. I used a 9 x 12 inch casserole pan and topped with shredded sharp cheese the last 15 minutes. 

After it was done, I sprinkled chopped green onions for color. Also I recommend Jiffy mix. I've used a dollar store brand and it was not as good. This will be a go to recipe for me.
Fantastic! The only problem is not eating it all in one sitting!
Comfort food at it's best! We call this 'Corn Slop" but its delicious!

I made this recipe for my Boston Terrier's 8th Birthday. He loves corn and sour cream. I added 1/2 cup of chopped cooked chicken and 1/2 cup of brown rice. I used 3 eggs and added 1/3 cup of heavy whipping cream. It came out so rich, decadent and scrumptious. My Boston assures me I could Beat Bobby Flay on Food Network with this dish. I tried it myself, and agree with his verdict.

This always a hit every time I make it. Three things I add to this recipe are 1/2 finely mined onion (squeezed of juice), a can of diced green chilies (drained) and about a cup of grated cheddar cheese.

You need to try this, it’s seriously good! Be sure to double this recipe. You’ll wish you had. It also is easy to refrigerate or freeze.
Made no substitutions and was perfect as is
I made this exactly as written, but added 1 cup of ham chunks to make it a main dish casserole. My family liked it and I will be adding it into my list.

I’ve never had anything like this before except at a Mexican restaurant I love and this is awesome! I saw it in an email and needed to use up some stuff in my pantry, so I decided to give it a try. I made it exactly as recipe stated, but I felt it was still a little bit jiggly at 45 minutes, so I added about 6 minutes to my cooking time. I used Jiffy cornbread mix and it came out creamy and sweet and corny. Delicious. I will definitely keep this recipe around. I will also be using better corn. I had the cheapest can of corn imaginable and it was still super yummy. Can’t wait for corn on the cob season!!!
Man, this is yummy! We've made this numerous times now and my family absolutely loves it! We don't change a thing in the recipe and we wouldn't change a thing. Delicious!!!!

I love this recipe, and so has everyone that has had some!! Kid's ask for seconds!! I add 1/3 cup brown sugar in the batter, and sprinkle a little more on the top before I bake it, it comes out amazing. So simple, and I've tripled it for big gatherings. Yum!!

Soooooo good! I took the advice of another reviewer and poured the butter in the pan first......I was out of creamed corn so I added one can of corn with water and another can without. I then added 1/4 cup of heavy cream. I used the rest of the ingredients posted and baked for one hour!! Soooooo good
Just made it again and forgot the sour cream, the wife loves it like that and says it doesn’t need it. Probably less fattening as well.
Too sweet for us. May try again without the added sugar. I would also use something smaller than an 8x8 pan. It was only a half inch high when finished baking.
Turned out perfect! Went just by the directions. Quick and easy.

item.name: Awesome and Easy Creamy Corn Casserole
